{"step_by_step_thinking": "Grape bunch" shaped colonies are a characteristic feature of Streptococcus. Streptococcus is a genus of bacteria that are spherical in shape and often form chains or clusters resembling a bunch of grapes. Staphylococcus, on the other hand, typically forms clusters resembling a bunch of grapes, but not in a chain-like arrangement. E.coli and Gonococci do not exhibit this characteristic morphology.", "answer_choice": "A"}
